verses.plain: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

tokens.t: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

verses.plain: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

tokens.t: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the
perverse in his ways despiseth him.

verses.plain: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

tokens.t: In the mouth of the foolish
a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

verses.plain: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

tokens.t: by the strength of the ox.

verses.plain: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

tokens.t: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

verses.plain: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

tokens.t: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not

verses.plain: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

tokens.t: to understand his way: but the folly of fools

verses.plain: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

tokens.t: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous

verses.plain: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

tokens.t: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

verses.plain: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

tokens.t: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

verses.plain: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

tokens.t: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof

verses.plain: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

tokens.t: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth

verses.plain: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

tokens.t: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man

verses.plain: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

tokens.t: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent

verses.plain: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

tokens.t: feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

verses.plain: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

tokens.t: soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

verses.plain: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

tokens.t: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

verses.plain: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

tokens.t: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

verses.plain: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

tokens.t: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich

verses.plain: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

tokens.t: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy

verses.plain: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

tokens.t: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth

verses.plain: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

tokens.t: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips

verses.plain: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

tokens.t: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful

verses.plain: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

tokens.t: strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

verses.plain: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

tokens.t: a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

verses.plain: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

tokens.t: the king’s honour: but in the want of people

verses.plain: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

tokens.t: the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

verses.plain: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

tokens.t: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

verses.plain: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

tokens.t: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

verses.plain: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

tokens.t: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but
in the midst of fools is made known.

verses.plain: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

tokens.t: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin

verses.plain: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.

tokens.t: toward a wise servant: but his wrath is

footnotes.text: his own…: Heb. the bitterness of his soul
the rich…: Heb. many are the lovers of the rich
